alert.note: Alert for Crawford; Dubois; Harrison; Perry (Indiana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 14 at 4:59PM EDT by NWS Louisville
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of west central Harrison, southeastern Dubois, Crawford, Perry and northwestern Meade Counties through 515 PM EDT/415 PM CDT/... At 459 PM EDT/359 PM CDT/, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from 6 miles northeast of English to 12 miles southeast of Jasper. Movement was south at 15 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Strong thunderstorms will be near... English around 510 PM EDT. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with these storms and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with these storms. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.
